joint appointment in the two departments
I've been working here for about the
twelve years before that I was a DuPont
company I served as a senior research
scientist there for 12 years violet
DuPont company had towards the end
actually form of my career at DuPont
company I worked on titanium dioxide
particles as I was leaving DuPont
company like anybody who leaves DuPont
company they make you sign a document
saying that you won't work in this area
anymore or not anymore where at least
for five years so I did but I all I knew
at that time was titanium dioxide I knew
everything about titanium dioxide so I
thought what can I do with this thing it
turned out that there are lots of
different applications for titanium
dioxide in addition to being an Oreo
cookie and toothpaste and in all the
paints in the world it's a very
photoactive material you can use that to
generate an electron and hole which can
be used for oxidizing or reducing things
so therefore it is a very good agent to
degrade pollutants in the atmosphere so
I got into this area of four
photocatalysis now titanium dioxide
itself has a very large band gap so
therefore it is sensitized by the higher
energy part of the solar spectrum it is
the UV light as such it is it uses only
eight to ten percent of the total
spectrum so what happens to the rest of
the spectrum it just doesn't get
absorbed by titanium dioxide so there
was my initial research how to modify
the electronic structure of writing my
oxide so it can be made to absorb
visible light which is the major part of
the solar spectrum so we did there a lot
and in doing so we also recognize the
fact that this material can also be used
as a photovoltaic so we got into
photovoltaics and we started working
with what is called a grad cell cell
which use titanium dioxide nanoparticles
as the main material for generating
electricity from light and while doing
that we also realize that this mechanism
is something very similar to what
happens in polymers where you don't have
a single interface like a silicon solar
cell device but multiple interfaces so
then we looked
looking into polymer materials and that
is one of the major area of my research
right now looking at the polymer
photovoltaic devices and we look at not
only the materials part of it we also
look at the device design device
geometry and all the issues that are
related to the interfaces there are a
whole bunch of them in the device and
that's one of the research areas in it
so all of these things revolve around
the theme of nanotechnology all of these
materials that I have been talking about
our nanostructured materials so in that
genre we also in fact in physics
department here there's a big interest
in magnetic nanomaterials so when things
become small in size they do funny
things like mag magnets also they lose
all their basically magnetization when
they become small so that means if you
make a magnetic recording for
high-density you want small particles
but when you make the particles father
it doesn't record anymore so how do you
make small particles yet keep their
magnetization that's the big theme of
the research of not only mine but lots
of people in this in the United States
and in the in the world so we look at
nano magnetism so being a materials
physicist I synthesized thing I make
things in make new materials design new
materials and then I of course
characterize it and look at for the
